metadata.Title: CVE-2020-15572 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - negligible.
metadata.Description: Tor before 0.4.3.6 has an out-of-bounds memory access that allows a remote denial-of-service (crash) attack against Tor instances built to use Mozilla Network Security Services (NSS), aka TROVE-2020-001.

notes.Note: alexmurray> tor in Ubuntu is not compiled with NSS support (instead we use OpenSSL) and so the tor package in Ubuntu is not affected by this vulnerability.

criterions.comment: tor: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
